deck_description:
🧬 Regenesis Centur-Ion Snake-Eye Deck Profile

 

🔥 Deck Type: Combo / Control Hybrid

 

🎯 Format: Advanced (2025, TCG)

 

🌐 Main Focus:

 

Use Centur-Ion’s Synchro recursion and boss monster setup

 

Enable strong extenders and disruption from Snake-Eye

 

Splash Regenesis and Unchained engines for mid-game recovery, board-breaking, and utility

 

Adapt to meta-heavy environments (Ryzeal, Kashtira, Malefic, Blue-Eyes) with a versatile Extra Deck toolbox

 

 

 

---

 

🧩 Core Engines and Game Plan

 

🏛️ 1. Centur-Ion Engine (Main Strategy)

 

Centur-Ion is your Synchro control core. It focuses on summoning high-impact monsters like Legatia and Primera, while constantly resetting your board.

 

Key Cards:

 

🔹 Centur-Ion Primera – Your playstarter; summons and recurs other Centur-Ions.

 

🔹 Centur-Ion Trudea – Non-target, non-destruction removal.

 

🔹 Centur-Ion Emeth VI – Searches field spells and resets the grind.

 

🔹 Centur-Ion Legatia – Level 12 Synchro boss, recursion & protection.

 

 

Field Spells:

 

🔹 World Legacy Whispers – Negates monster effects.

 

🔹 World Legacy Secrets – Negates monster effects (used with Emeth VI).

 

🔹 Centur-Ion World – Buffs and stabilizes Centur-Ions.

 

 

 

---

 

🐍 2. Snake-Eye Package (Extenders & Control Options)

 

Snake-Eye provides board presence and field manipulation while enabling quick Synchro/Link setups.

 

Key Cards:

 

🔸 Snake-Eye Ash – Searches and facilitates additional summons.

 

🔸 Snake-Eye Oak / Poplar – Help with continuous board presence.

 

🔸 Original Diabellstar (optional splash) – Great synergy with Snake-Eye to get into Regenerations and field control.

 

 

 

---

 

♻️ 3. Regenesis Engine (Toolbox & Recursion)

 

Not Fire Kings! These are the utility cards like Regenesis Genesis Field (if running it), or similar "regeneration" or recursion-based tools. This engine powers resource loops and allows you to recycle lost pieces.

 

Function:

 

Reuse discarded Synchro materials or Snake-Eye monsters.

 

Create loop setups with Centur-Ion for second-turn grind.

 

Boost mid-late game tempo after trading resources.

 

 

 

---

 

🔥 4. Unchained Mini-Engine (Optional)

 

This helps against boards you can't out easily or to bait out negates. Also fuels Link Climb.

 

Example Cards:

 

🔸 Unchained Soul of Disaster

 

🔸 Abominable Unchained Soul

 

🔸 Escape of the Unchained (board pop synergy)

---

 

💥 Disruption & Utility (Hand Traps & Side Options)

 

Droll & Lock Bird / Ash Blossom / Ghost Belle – Meta-stoppers.

 

Effect Veiler – Synchro synergy + monster negation.

 

Nibiru / Gamma – Against swarming decks.

 

Evenly Matched / Dimensional Barrier – Blowout board wipes or floodgates.

 

Trap Trick – Access your backrow tech reliably.

 

 

 

---

 

🧠 Playstyle Summary:

 

Turn Goal

 

1st Set up Centur-Ion Legatia + World Legacy + I:P Masquerena. Backed by traps and Snake-Eye.

2nd Break board with Unchained/Snake-Eye. Climb into Accesscode/Unicorn. Synchro climb if needed.

Grind Regenesis and Emeth VI provide longevity. Keep generating advantage through loops.

 

 

 

---

 

✅ Why This Deck Works Now

 

Synchro toolbox adapts to any game state.

 

Centur-Ion is one of the most consistent Synchro lines in modern formats.

 

Snake-Eye gives strong early-game and recovery.

 

Regenesis and World Legacy spells/traps give you a midgame edge.

 

Hard to out boss monsters + multiple win paths (Synchro, Link, grind).

 

 

 

---

deck_excerpt: Using Resonators to build a great board with Red Dragon Archfiend and potentially into Red Supernova Dragon
deck_description: Using Resonators to build a great board with Red Dragon Archfiend and potentially into Red Supernova Dragon
Una historia de dos hermanas llena de maldiciones, tragedia, serpientes y venganza
Without Ulcanix this deck is like 80 bucks

The set The Perpetual Maze is a Selection Pack, released on June 4th, 2025. MASTER DUEL - HOW TO PLAY! COMBO RYU-GE SWORDSOUL DECK - NEW SELECTION PACK: THE PERPETUAL MAZE. Hopefully this video will help everyone build and play decks more easily. Below is the deck profile for everyone to refer to.

This deck needs no introductions. For the past few formats, it has been a highly consistent deck to compete against the meta. From being the reason Hot Red Dragon Archfiend King Calamity got sent to the shadow realm, to being able to play under the Mulcharmy Cards AND Droll & Lock Bird , Centur-ions find themselves an very niche this format as well. While on the surface, it might seem like a strategy that fails to compete against the likes of Ryzeal, Mitsurugi and even Maliss, well timed applications of the card and the engines in this deck can put up a fight that would give any of the archtypes I mentioned a reason to fail. 

 

Main Combos

  1. Opening: Centur-Ion Trudea - this is one of the main starters in terms of the openers for the deck, not the most optimal, but it can get you where you need to be. She forces the player to open with a normal summon, then using her effect to place herself and any other another Centur-Ion monster from the Hand or MD to the S/T Zone as a Continuious Trap, normally we would choose to place Centur-Ion Primera , then you use Centur-Ion Primera to SS herself from the S/T Zone to your side of the field, which would trigger her on-summon effect, to grab any Centur-Ion card from deck to the hand. If you don't already have a copy of Wake Up Centur-Ion! in your hand, this will be the optimal time to add the card, even thought you may be tempted to add the field spell, do not. Activate Wake Up Centur-Ion! , since you have a Centur-Ion monster in the S/T Zone, you get to SS a token with either LV 4 or LV 8. Optimally, for recursion, SS as a Level 4. Once this is done, Synchro Summon the monster and token for the LV 8 Synchro Centur-Ion Primera Primus , which will add you an Emblema card from Deck or GY to your hand, here you will grab Emblema Oath , then activate it and (if you do not have Centur-Ion Atrii in hannd already) choose to place a Centur-Ion monster face-up in the S/T Zone and place Centur-Ion Atrii (NOTE: Once a Centur-Ion Atrii remains face-up on field during the turn you activate this, you will be locked into only SS Centur-Ion monsters from the ED). Activate Centur-Ion Atrii and SS her from the S/T Zone, then use her on summon effect to Draw a card and then you CAN destroy 2 cards on field, one you control and one the opponent controls. After this, Synchro Summon using Centur-Ion Atrii and Centur-Ion Primera Primus for Centur-Ion Auxila (if you are going 1st or need to search a specific engine piece) or Centur-Ion Legatia (if you are going 2nd or just want additional non-engine resources). Use Wake Up Centur-Ion! in GY, banishing itself to send a Centur-Ion card from deck to GY, you would normally send Centur-Ion Phalanx to recur a Synchro Centruion monster (useful if you get hit with a nibiru). if you have more bodies and can continue to play, do so in a manner that gives you an edge. DO NOT FORGET THE EFFECT OF THE LEVEL 12 CENTUR-ION SUNCHROS AT THE EP TO PLACE ANY CENTUR-ION MONSTER FROM GY OR BANISH ZONE, FACE UP IN THE S/T ZONE.
  2. Opening: Stand Up Centur-Ion! - this is the ideal opener for the deck. Start by activating Stand Up Centur-Ion! , use it's effect the turn it was activated to send a card from hand and then place any Centur-Ion monster from deck, face up in the S/T Zone, normally you would choose to grab Centur-Ion Trudea , from here, the combo remains the same as Combo 1. 
  3. Opening: Emblema Oath - this is similar to opening Stand Up Centur-Ion! , you normally choose to set a Centur-Ion Spell facedown which would be Stand Up Centur-Ion! , although if you already have the field spell in hand, you are free to choose. If you choose to place the field spell, the combo follows the line of combo 1 and 2, until you have to SS the token, since choosing to Synchro Lv 8, you WILL get to add the Emblema Card from deck or GY to hand, but since Emblema Oath is once per turn, it woul be ideal to SS the token as a LV 8, and Synchro into a Level 12 directly, specifically Centur-Ion Auxila (searching either Centur-Ion Bonds (to place a body in the S/T Zone from the hand or GY) or Centur-Ion Atrii to Normal summon and get an additional draw, this all depends on your preference or hand) or Centur-Ion Legatia (if goinf 2nd and need to move a card that is giving you difficulty).
  4. Opening: Centur-Ion Primera - this is normally a card you don't really object to opening with as the only starter, but in formats where Droll & Lock Bird is going around, and opening this as the only starter means you will definitely need to be adding cards to build or break a board, it is not the most optimal. Although, if this is the had you are given, make the most of it. Since this will be you NS, use the effect on Summon to add Stand Up Centur-Ion! to hand (if you get drolled, pray there is no more HT to follow). Then activate Stand Up Centur-Ion! and use the effect to place Centur-Ion Trudea in the S/T Zone from deck. SS Centur-Ion Trudea from S/T Zone as a Lv4. Attempt to place Centur-Ion Trudea back into the S/T zone and place another Centur-Ion monster in the S/T zone with it. Normally the choice is based on what you want your endboard to be, Centur-Ion Gargoyle II is the best option here as it can also modulate it's level and recur itself back into the hand from the GY once used as a synchro material. Remember, in this comboline, you already have a non-tuner Centur-Ion in the S/T Faceup, so you will need to be able to add a tuner Centur-Ion that can SS itself during the opponent's MP. If you opted to Place Centur-Ion Gargoyle II , then SS it as a Lv8 and Synchro Summon using it and Centur-Ion Primera for Centur-Ion Auxila , which will protect all S/T face up on the field. In the EP, place Centur-Ion Primera in the S/P Zone and use them to make either a Crimson Dragon or Centur-Ion Auxila based on the situation. Crimson Dragon is normally a better choice as it can bring and other Synchro 12 from your ED.

Notes/Rulings

  1. This deck can be played in a minimal combo way, to avoid Nibiru, the Primal Being and set up to play in the opponent's turn.
  2. The Bystials help to give the Centur-Ions an extra push to do some unorthodox plays that can catch opponents off guard.
  3. Any Centurion MD Monster + Lv6 Bystial gives you Chaos Angel or Bystial Dis Pater.
  4. Any Hand Trap + Level 8 (except Centur-Ion Primera Primus ) give you access to Psychic End Punisher 
  5. All Level 12 Centur-Ion Synchros places a Centur-Ion monster from the GY or Banish Zone in the S/T Zone during EITHER player's EP.
  6. Crimson Dragon's effect to add a S/T from deck to hand is an on summon effect, the effect to tag out into another synchro monster is a Quick Effect.
  7. Stand Up Centur-Ion!'s effect to Synchro Summon does not only trigger when you SS a monster, but also if your Opponent SS a monster. And it does not need to use only Centurion Monster or the Monster that SS to trigger the effect. 
  8. Red Supernova Dragon does not banish itself for cost. If it is moved from the field before it can  resolve, the other card on the opponent's field will get banished, but it will not return during your next EP. Also, if you use this effect in your turn and it leave the field by it's own effect, it WILL SS itself back to the field during that same EP. This is not an activated effect, but unlike SP, and can trigger some effects.
  9. Blue-Eyes Ultimate Spirit Dragon can SS from the GY, Centur-Ion Auxila or Crimson Dragon from the GY if either of them were Synchro Summoned and then sent to the GY.
  10. Monsters summoned with the effect of Crimson Dragon are considered Synchro Summoned and can return to the field from GY/Banish if sent there from field.
  11. Powersink Stone counts each time monster effects are activated by BOTH players in the turn and will affect both players once the first 2 monster effects resolves (anywhere). If there is a chain 5 with all of the links being monsters, when the chain is resolving, chain 5 will give a counter to Powersink Stone and chain 4 wil give the second counter to Powersink Stone , after that, if the other monster in the remaining chain links are on the field, their effect become negated. While Powersink Stone is in effect, neither player can attempt to activate monster effects on the field, example; Powersink Stone is live and the opponent has Haggard Lizardose on field, the would not be able to banish for cost using Haggard Lizardose effect, then have it resolve negated.
  12. If during the EP, after Powersink Stone has removed its counters, 2 monster effects are activated, on resoloution, new counters will be placed on Powersink Stone and they will not be removed after, since removing the counters can only happen ONCE PER TURN. The counters will remain on Powersink Stone until the EP of the next turn, or if the card leaves the field.
  13. Centur-Ion Phalanx is a trap card, hence, it's effect in the GY can be activated during the opponent's turn.
Combo Guide Coming Soon....

"The Grand Confluence: Where Ancient Rites Meet Celestial Might" Embark on a mystical journey where ancient Egyptian deities, embodied by the Horus monsters, join forces with celestial beings from The Sanctuary in the Sky. Feel the earth tremble as King's Sarcophagus awakens dormant powers, while the harmonious melodies of Melodious monsters echo across the field, disrupting your opponent's rhythm. But beware, for beneath this celestial facade lurks the cunning of the Dark World, ready to unleash its hidden terrors. This deck weaves a rich narrative of conflicting forces, each vying for supremacy, culminating in a truly epic duel where only the most adaptable duelist will emerge victorious.

deck_description:
Dino Control 2025 GOAT

The best Dinosaur build of all the variants I'm trying out

Stay tuned for Dino deck #3 some time in the future
あなたの息子も私をママと呼ぶ

Yu-Gi-Oh Tabletop Format - Merlantean Abyss

Yu-Gi-Oh Tabletop Format (YGOT) is a format that infuses the combos and strategies of the modern YGO meta with the pace of play of earlier YGO by adapting the TCG to a 9 x 9 grid-based game board format where the player pilots an "avacard" (a designated link monster listed in the side deck) across the game board to eliminate the opponent's life points or capture the opposing players' avacard, summoning monsters and setting spells and traps along the way. This format is compatible for 2-4 players.

This deck built from the Atlantean and Mermail archetypes is a starting point to understand the format and should not be considered competitive-focused. It primarily focuses on bringing out your XYZ monsters and swarming the field with monsters while also recycling them to your deck and hand, often with high risk, high reward tactics. Worldsea Dragon Zealantis is the avacard.

More information, including a link to the rulebook for the format, is forthcoming.

basic primite fiendsmith list for the most part. pivots easily between both combo lines using dipity as a bridge between them, though the heart and soul of the deck is the skull. skull turns on dragon's mind and can act as an easy anchor to remove a card with superpoly if your opponent plays low to the ground to make archfiend's manifestation. superpoly sits in main due to the meta being mostly mono-attribute decks right now, could fluctuate into the side depending on meta changes as things go on. maindeck ghost belle is a local meta call since there isn't a single deck at my locals it's a dead draw against.

chaos angel is optimistic. do NOT count on it, but it can come up every so often.

Necroquip can be replaced but so can agnumday, either one isn't super important and extradeck is pretty tight, but kinda flexible.

deck_excerpt: Domain Format: Budget Structure Deck Amplified
deck_description:
Endless Bodies, Strategic Destruction.
This is a beginner-friendly Domain Format list built upon a $9.99 MSRP purchase of the Structure Deck: Sacred Beasts. It consists of a $20 upgrade of cards purchased from sites like TCGplayer.
(I blame Unchained Soul Lord of Yama for eating 1/4 OF THE BUDGET)

Deckmaster: Dark Beckoning Beast 
Domain Restrictions: DARK // FIEND
Made for Domain Format: Join the Community Discord!

To create this upgrade, please remove these 11 cards and any duplicate cards from the SD: Sacred Beasts (reference the sidedeck): 
Note: Please also remove the 2 included Phantom Tokens

  • ydke://LsnvAZdzKgR0L7UBZ6u7BK2pWwDMN+MFaIi1AdJz1gUlXHgCg4I9BRVY9wDHvMUAqYfOAaSXOANje9QEsLKiASWfRAPheMkE+TLFAIf4ygDUGgQAKfJQBZAGIwCQf44FPw0aAll7YwRGSGQE7ydRALsKYQSLajMDok+KAAZs4QHU+vgA!gOWVAoapsAU=!KlHOAGfCLQLYxvAES6rhAieO2QHaJW0AbkpvBNlSlAD2hZgAee6IA6BSfQU=!
  • View on YGOprodeck
  • Structure Deck Full Contents (YGOprodeck)

Next, you will want to buy and add these 39 cards to the deck: 

  • ydke://U+xIAODxaQVB2qsEZgEeAA70lAKfm2kFJ/o2BLjEKgMHJHQCxDtHBcExnwNWzx4DkFaQAQ//8QU6upoCcYFxAZLptgOCS7kF/byFBVXO4wMN9QwBPkiiATijNwXP79AE3xYvA2hesQJeHkoC+5oxAw==!hjiVAxhvrQEK9sYC6Py9BP7j7AFh0cEBiVRyAQC5CAR77PgCt95HBKKjRAS/DkkC!!
  • View on YGOprodeck
  • View on TCGplayer Cart

Additional Resources can be found here:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1c8_W7TLHoExz9Iq2yNBKG4kniKN3fjamfMVRehPRitQ/edit?usp=sharing

Domain Format General Rules:

  • Singleton Format: Every card restricted to 1 copy per deck.
  • 60-card Format: Each Main Deck must contain exactly 60 cards.
  • 4-player Pods: Each player competes individually in an all-out battle against three opponents.
  • Deckmaster Restrictions: Each player chooses a "Deckmaster" which dictates the allowed types and attributes for their deck.
  • Deckmaster Contract: A Deckmaster can be summoned from a designated "Deckmaster Zone" using normal summoning rules. After switching zones, Deckmasters may return to the "Deckmaster Zone," where they start the game.

Refer here for additional rules and exceptions:

https://www.domainformat.com/rules 

Broad Categories

This simple strategy has cards that fall into three simple categories:

  • Self-Destruction
  • Big Attack 
  • Field Swarming

Primary Packages: Sacred Beasts, Yubel, Unchained

Reccommend Sacred Beasts Guides (from Jesse Kotton and Revz Cards):

  • https://youtu.be/Ul_4K--3dv8?si=CoqURxyJtD_C1YHw
  • https://youtu.be/t99kE2M5lvU 

Reccommened Yubel Guides (from Gnurrgard and PhantomsYGO):

  • https://youtu.be/_jt5LLTfN9Q 
  • https://youtu.be/CvJGhAEMxaw?si=W0px_fdC1WsbmfH5 

What do we want our Deckmaster to do? Dark Beckoning Beast 
- Combo Starter
- Find Sacred Beast Spell/Traps
- Additional Normal Summon 

A fantastic Normal Summon for the strategy, Dark Beckoning Beast allows the deck to easily put monsters on the field for out Link-Summoning plays through its search ability and additional normal summon. The most important card to search is Opening of the Spirit Gates, which not only provides another search, and revive a fiend, but also gives us the ability to recur a continous spell from our GY. 
From only the Normal Summon of Dark Beckoning Beast and 2 discards, we will be able to set up a full field of a Negate, a Negate , a Disruption , and lastly a Destruction. 

You may also choose to access the Sacred Beast combo lines with Dark Beckoning Beast, which will be able to set up 1-2 Sacred Beasts on the field. The important card to search using Dark Beckoning Beast for this combo would be the Dark Summoning Beast to summon a Sacred Beast straight from deck. 
If you wish to summon out the Fusion Armityle the Chaos Phantasm - Phantom of Fury instead, it can be done by sending all the Sacred Beasts to GY using Chaos Core (use Unchained Soul of Sharvara to target it, searched by Unchained Soul Lord of Yama) and then fuse the Armityle the Chaos Phantasm - Phantom of Fury by using Fiendsmith's Sequence to shuffle back all the Sacred Beasts to deck.  

Dark Beckoning Beast can add: 

  • Opening of the Spirit Gates 
  • Awakening of the Sacred Beasts 
  • Phantasmal Martyrs
  • Dimension Fusion Destruction  
  • Fallen Paradise 
  • Chaos Summoning Beast / Phantasmal Summoning Beast / Dark Summoning Beast 
  • Cerulean Skyfire / Hyper Blaze 

Please remember that the additional normal summon provided by Dark Beckoning Beast can be used on any Fiend monster with 0 Atk /0 Def, regardless of its Level. 

Self-Destruction 
- Destroy Spirit of Yubel over and over and over...
- Destroy Unchained cards to summon monsters! 
- Trigger Unchained Soul Lord of Yama

Spirit of Yubel has no once-per-turn on its ability to summon out a Yubel  if it is destroyed. This lack of once-per-turn can be leveraged by destroying it using Nightmare Pain and our various Unchained cards, all while generating monster advantage. You always want to be destroying Spirit of Yubel if there is any card that requires a card of ours to be destroyed. If you happen to not have Spirit of Yubel on the field, please check the GY to see if you can use Gruesome Grave Squirmer GY effect to revive Spirit of Yubel. These Yubel cards - Spirit of Yubel , Yubel , Yubel - Terror Incarnate , Yubel - The Ultimate Nightmare - all allow us to easily generate monsters on the field so long as are destroying them. 

The primary entry point to accessing Spirit of Yubel is Samsara D Lotus. Samsara D Lotus can be revived from GY by Opening of the Spirit Gates or Muckraker From the Underworld once it is sent to GY using Aerial Eater. 

Spirit of Yubel can add:

  • Nightmare Pain 
  • Eternal Favorite 
  • Mature Chronicle 

The ability to benefit off destruction of our cards also allows this deck to play better into disruptions that destroy our cards, because we will then be able to profit off that destruction. (However this only applies to monster destruction and not Spell/Trap Destruction)

Field Swarming
- Make sure you can summon your Moon of the Closed Heaven and Unchained Soul Lord of Yama 
- Use Spirit of Yubel and Opening of the Spirit Gates to get many monsters
- Link Summon using your swarm of monsters

The Fiend Extra Deck is extremely generic, which allows us to easily pivot any monster we obtain into advantage. Our Deckmaster Dark Beckoning Beast is fantastic in its ability to put 2 dark fiends on the field with only one Normal Summon. Opening of the Spirit Gates is also fantastic for its ability to revive a fiend monster from GY. 

In particuar, we want to summon out Moon of the Closed Heaven in order to gain access to Fiendsmith's Sequence. This is because the easiest way to find Samsara D Lotus, and by extention the Yubel archetype, is by using Fiendsmith's Sequence to summon Aerial Eater to send Samsara D Lotus to GY. 
Because Moon of the Closed Heaven can use any effect monster as material, we play Danger! monsters as additional extension.

When we have Fiend monsters, we are able to easily create an Unchained Soul Lord of Yama. This is the primary point of access for the Unchained engine. The most important endpiece of the Unchained engine is Unchained Soul of Rage , which can be easily made if we add Unchained Soul of Sharvara using Unchained Soul Lord of Yama.  

In the cases of Grind Games, please remember that Opening of the Spirit Gates can add back a Continous Spell from GY, and that Awakening of the Sacred Beasts can add back a Continous Trap from GY.

Big Attack 
- Use the Big 4000 ATK of Raviel, Lord of Phantasms and Hamon, Lord of Striking Thunder!
- Reflect battle damage through Nightmare Pain!  

While all of the monsters in the Yubel archetype have 0 ATK / 0 DEF , the battle damage redirection ability of Nightmare Pain allows the deck to easily OTK given our opponents have highly statted monsters. Additionally, because our opponents are forced by Nightmare Pain to attack into Yubel monsters, they sometimes will have no choice but to die by their hubris! 

Attack Power is where the Sacred Beasts shine the most. In addition to  Raviel, Lord of Phantasms and Hamon, Lord of Striking Thunder each holding a respectable 4000 ATK, their fusion monster Armityle the Chaos Phantasm gains 10000 ATK (during our turn only)! The "dificulty" lies in summoning these monsters, however we are fortunate in that we never have to summon them using their own ridiculous conditions. Due to Phantasmal Summoning Beast and Dark Summoning Beast, we can directly IGNORE their summoning conditions AND summon them from Deck! Both of the Summoning Beast can be searched using our deckmaster Dark Beckoning Beast. 

Summoning out the 10000 ATK Armityle the Chaos Phantasm is similarly easy. By using Chaos Core (searchable through our deckmaster Dark Beckoning Beast), we can send all the required Sacred Beast Fusion Materials to GY, and summon out Armityle the Chaos Phantasm through the fusion effect of Fiendsmith's Sequence by shuffling the Materials back into Deck! 

If the Sacred Beasts high attack power does not end the game, use of their continous trap Awakening of the Sacred Beasts most definetly will bring victory closer. This powerful trap has effects that scale based on the number of Sacred Beasts controled, and is the primary endboard piece for the Sacred Beast strategy. 

Other Considerations: 

Monsters: Tour Guide From the Underworld , Borrelsword Dragon , Santa Claws , Diabellstar the Black Witch , Lady Labrynth of the Silver Castle , The Winged Dragon of Ra - Sphere Mode , D/D/D Vice King Requiem ( + Dark Contract with the Gate ),  Danger! Mothman! 

Extra Deck: Goblin Bikers Gone Bonkers , Super Starslayer TY-PHON - Sky Crisis ,  Goblin's Crazy Beast , D/D/D Stone King Darius , Promethean Princess, Bestower of Flames + Knightmare Phoenix , Knightmare Mermaid , Relinquished Anima , Unchained Soul of Anguish , Predaplant Verte Anaconda , Topologic Bomber Dragon / Topologic Trisbaena / Topologic Zeroboros 

Spell/Trap: Soul Demolition , Farewelcome Labrynth , Fiendsmith's Sanct , Foolish Burial , Titanocider , Monster Reborn , Change of Heart / Snatch Steal , Torrential Tribute , Heavy Storm / Twin Twisters , Gigantic Thundercross 

Removed from Deck: 
Monsters: Lady Labrynth of the Silver Castle , Tour Guide From the Underworld , Danger! Mothman! 
Extra Deck: Super Starslayer TY-PHON - Sky Crisis , Predaplant Verte Anaconda , Borrelsword Dragon , Goblin Bikers Gone Bonkers , Unchained Soul of Anguish
Spell/Traps: Torrential Tribute , Fiendsmith's Sanct , Soul Demolition ,  Farewelcome Labrynth , Gigantic Thundercross 

To Recap

Important Cards: Opening of the Spirit Gates , Unchained Soul of Rage , Spirit of Yubel , Awakening of the Sacred Beasts 
Strategy Elevator Pitch: Endless Destruction and Rebirth. 

Best Non-Budget Upgrades: Phantom of Yubel , Nightmare Throne , Fiendsmith's Requiem , Super Polymerization + Yubel - The Loving Defender Forever, Varudras, the Final Bringer of the End Times , A Bao A Qu, the Lightless Shadow 

Unleash the Cycle: Destroy. Float. Link. Dominate.
